speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series
text: Pamela Fryman  * * *   **This is Part One:[[7.10]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_10/back_talk_1.html "Back Talk \[1\]")**  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _Act One.  PROLOGUE [Kelsey Grammer introduces a few clips from "Back Talk," the first part of this special two-parter.]  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. It's Christmas Week in Seattle.  Not only is the Space Needle supporting fairy lights, but the apartment is also adorned with stylish Christmas decorations.  Martin is at work on a little toy Santa when Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Good Lord, Dad.  You've been tinkering with that thing for hours.  Don't you think that maybe "Dancing Santa" could sit this Christmas out?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I've got to get it ready for your big party tomorrow night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no need, Dad.  There will be plenty of things to delight my guests.  We'll be caroling and playing games.  Oh, and I'll be reading "A Child's Christmas in Wales" to bring the evening to a close.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to himself_] That should do it! _Frasier opens the door to Roz, wrapped up for winter.  She is carrying an extravagant silver punch bowl._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't stay, I just stopped by to drop off your punch bowl.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Roz.  Say, what kind of punch did you serve?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, first I filled it with ice.  Then I just poured orange juice and vodka over it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, that's just a giant screwdriver!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, so?  What am I, Martha Stewart?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!  Thanks anyway, I'm really going to be needing this bowl tomorrow evening.  There's going to be a crowd of guests. I've invited the entire building - including Cam Winston.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: In the spirit of Christmas I've decided to put an end to our feud.

speaker: Roz
text: What are you feuding about?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he parks his SUV right next to Frasier's Beemer!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, that car is grotesquely oversized.  I've often been forced to exit from the passenger's side.  Many a time, I've been brought to grief on my gear shift! [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Roz
text: Why doesn't he just back in?

speaker: Martin
text: Are you kidding?  He can barely hit that space even when the guy's car isn't there!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne. [_calls_] Bye, guys! [_they ad-lib goodbyes_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You leaving?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, there's something I'd like to talk to you about.

speaker: Roz
text: What is it?

speaker: Daphne
text: The other day I found out something about Dr. Crane I wasn't supposed to know.

speaker: Roz
text: [_excited_] Frasier?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, his brother.  Apparently, he's had a crush on me for years.

speaker: Roz
text: [_exhales_] Thank God!

speaker: Daphne
text: What do you mean, "Thank God?"

speaker: Roz
text: I've been afraid for months I'd be the one to blow the secret.

speaker: Daphne
text: You mean you knew?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, everybody kinda did.

speaker: Daphne
text: And nobody said anything?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, if Niles wasn't ready to say anything, it wasn't our place to do it.  Well, who spilt the beans?  It was Frasier, wasn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but he doesn't know he told me.

speaker: Roz
text: He doesn't?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he was on those painkillers for his back and, well, I can't very well discuss it with Dr. Crane, he's so close to Dr. Crane, if I told him he might tell Dr. Crane and then Dr. Crane might feel embarrassed.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, why confuse things?

speaker: Daphne
text: The whole thing's just a bit awkward.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't see why.  Niles has a girlfriend now, so obviously he's gotten over you, and you're engaged to Donny.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose when you look at it like that there's really no reason to feel awkward. _The elevator doors then open to reveal Niles who steps into the corridor with some books.  Daphne becomes very nervous and looks away from him._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there's a Christmas tableau: "Naughty & Nice."

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd see you inside but... I just have to... [_excuses_] Take out the garbage! [_Niles looks confused_] It's in my pocket. _Daphne rushes onto the elevator with Roz as Niles enters the apartment and greets his brother and father._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I brought those caroling books you asked for.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes them_] Thank you so much.  Yes, here we are.  "The First Songs From A Victorian Christmas" and "Elizabethan Tidings of Joy."  Now we're ready to party!  Niles, what do you think? Should we start with the caroling or should we hold off until we've played a spirited game of "The Minister's Cat?"

speaker: Niles
text: Start with the game, then the caroling, then perhaps the guests will be ready for another game.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Russian Roulette!

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks at watch_] So, I'm off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, if you're not busy this evening, perhaps you could help me string popcorn garlands.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, unfortunately, I have to see Maris tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Maris?!  What the hell do you have to see her for?

speaker: Niles
text: Sadly, to pay my condolences.  It seems our old gardener has passed away unexpectedly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not Yoshi.  Gosh, that's too bad.

speaker: Niles
text: He had a heart attack when he was out trimming Maris's elaborate hedge maze.  The paramedics never had a chance.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I feel bad about Yoshi, but are you sure it's a good idea spending the evening with Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she's terribly upset.  Maris and Yoshi were very close. In fact I remember he once made a topiary likeness of her and wept without shame when it developed root rot.  Well, the problem is, I had to cancel on Mel tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  Well, Niles, if you want my advice, I wouldn't mention Maris to Mel.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: The last thing a new girlfriend wants to hear is that you're consoling your ex-wife.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I hate to lie to Mel.  Though I do see your point, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Ha-hey!  There he goes! _The "Dancing Santa" springs to life, to Martin's joy.  It begins wiggling its hips from side to side, dancing to music.  Niles and Frasier are horrified._

speaker: Niles
text: [_putting on a joyful facade_] Dad!  Santa's back!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  It's the darndest thing, every year when I take him out of the box, something's wrong with it.  But I always manage to fix him again.

speaker: Niles
text: Good for you, Dad. [_to Frasier, sotto voce_] I told you to dunk it underwater.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did! _Niles exits as Frasier looks concerned at the grotesque figurine.  FADE OUT_ **ANYONE FOR A HOT BUTTERED MARGARITA?** _Scene Two - KACL Foyer It is the office Christmas party.  The foyer is decorated for Christmas, Mexican style.  Even the food has the taste of Mexico. Frasier is nibbling as Kenny approaches._

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey Doc.  Merry Christmas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Kenny.  My, the station has certainly outdone itself this year with the Christmas in _Mexico_ theme.

speaker: Kenny
text: It was my idea.  It hit me when I realized their sauces are red and green.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Well, that's why you're the boss.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier, what time's your party tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quiets her_] Please keep your voice down, you're the only one from the station I've invited.

speaker: Roz
text: The only one?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but don't worry, there'll be scads of people, because I invited everyone in my building.  Seven o'clock!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Gil, Merry Christmas.

speaker: Gil
text: And to you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Gil
text: I hope you've saved room for dessert.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you been baking?

speaker: Gil
text: I have!  Gingerbread men.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my, [_looks_] don't they look... muscular!

speaker: Gil
text: Yes well, my wife and I made a New Year's Resolution; Deb and I have joined a gym to slim down and buff up.  We needed these to inspire us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah yes, there's nothing to strengthen a dieter's resolve like a good motivational pastry.

speaker: Gil
text: Precisely.  The problem is they're so delicious, I've already had three. [_picks one up_] This is my last little man, I promise. [_starts to eat him_] Oh, Gil, who are you kidding? [_wanders off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_aside_] No one, Gil.

speaker: Mel
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mel.

speaker: Mel
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, gosh, I never expected to see you here.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, well, I was one of the doctors on "Health Chat" during cosmetic surgery week.  I did a segment on breast augmentation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, how uplifting! [_laughs but Mel doesn't find it funny_]

speaker: Mel
text: Yes well, Niles is hanging up our coats.  So did you two have a good dinner last night?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, actually we didn't have dinner last night, I was too busy planning my party.  But please don't mention it to any of my colleagues, they're not invited...

speaker: Frasier
text: Mel?

speaker: Niles
text: [_arrives_] Frasier, Frasier, glad I saw you.  About last night, if Mel should ask...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: And you...?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid so.

speaker: Niles
text: Damn you!  Well, you're the one who told me to lie to her and now you fail to back me up! _Niles hits him on the shoulder -- well, "hit" being used loosely -- and then goes to find Mel. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shouts after him_] Well, I'm a little preoccupied, I'm having a party tonight for two hundred people! _Kenny is walking past and hears this.  He looks upset and Frasier looks guilty._

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, I won't lie to you, Doc.  This hurts! _Meanwhile, Niles tries to reason with Mel, who has already put on her coat to leave._

speaker: Niles
text: Mel, Mel, darling, please, quick, quick come here, sweetheart.

speaker: Mel
text: Niles-

speaker: Niles
text: I know you're upset, darling, but...

speaker: Mel
text: Please, we're at a party.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, you're right, we'll talk about it later.

speaker: Mel
text: No, we'll talk about it now.  Just put on your party face.

speaker: Mel
text: Don't embarrass me - as if I could be further embarrassed after you lied to me.

speaker: Niles
text: I can explain.

speaker: Mel
text: No, no, no, you don't need to.  When a man lies about where he's been, it's not hard to guess the reason.  So what's the little whore's name?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs to cover_] No, no, darling.  The reason I told you that I was dining with Frasier was actually, I was out...

speaker: Mel
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: Getting your Christmas present.

speaker: Mel
text: [_covers her mouth with embarrassment and happiness_] My present!  Oh, darling, I'm so sorry.  I should have known.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so glad you're forgiving me.  Or is that your party face?

speaker: Mel
text: No, of course not. [_kisses him_] Why don't you hang my coat back up and I'll get us something to drink?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course. _Niles does as Mel wanders over to Frasier at the punch bowl and pours a drink._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mel, this is awkward.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, no, no, no, Frasier.  Niles explained everything and while I don't like being lied to, I do appreciate why he did it.

speaker: Niles
text: [_runs over, worried_] Ooh, hello!  Hello, chatting, are we?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I was just apologizing for my part in your little misunderstanding.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, then of course you were discussing the present.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, the present. [_lifts glass_] And the future, Maris is all in the past!

speaker: Mel
text: [_sharply_] Maris?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Mel
text: You were with Maris last night?

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Mel
text: How _dare_ you?! [_leaves to coat stand_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] Anything else in the box, Pandora? _Niles tries to again to win back Mel.  Roz is standing just behind them._

speaker: Niles
text: Mel, please.

speaker: Mel
text: Don't touch me, no.

speaker: Niles
text: Party face, party face.

speaker: Mel
text: Forget the party face.  You're obviously still in love with you and I'm not about to share you.  Goodbye. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, don't pretend to be sorry.  All you care about is your precious party that you're hosting tonight! _Niles exits as the room falls silent and everyone else looks at Frasier, upset that they're not invited.  Frasier slowly inches out of the foyer.  End of Act One.  Act Two._  Come 'A Wassailing To Frasier Crane's Holiday Fest Elliot Bay Towers #1901 Regrets Only  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is pouring out some punch as Daphne and Donny fool around on the piano.  Donny is playing a simple, one fingered version of "Jingle Bells."_

speaker: Donny
text: Don't be nervous, honey.

speaker: Donny
text: Bring it home, Daphne!

speaker: Donny
text: Daphne Moon, everybody!  We'll take your requests.

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering from kitchen_] How about a little "Silent Night"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop that!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Those are for the party.

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks around_] In case you haven't noticed: I am the party.

speaker: Donny
text: Didn't the invitation say it was for seven o'clock?

speaker: Daphne
text: I hope people knew it was for tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop worrying, they'll be here.  They're probably just fashionably late.  People do love to make an entrance, you know.

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha!  Daphne, open the floodgates! _However, when Daphne opens the door, there stands just one very miserable Niles with a bag of Christmas presents._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane.  Isn't Mel with you?

speaker: Niles
text: No, she won't be coming.  We broke up.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_anxious_] What?

speaker: Niles
text: Yup, this afternoon.

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodness, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you try to call her, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I left a dozen messages.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, no, I'm so sorry.  How long were you guys together?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no that long.  Still, I was optimistic.

speaker: Donny
text: Did you talk about moving in together?  Make any long term plans?

speaker: Niles
text: This is really bringing out the lawyer in you, isn't it? [_laughs_]

speaker: Donny
text: The bartender, actually.  I was just wondering how big a drink to make you.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, big!  Scotch. _Donny, Niles and Daphne go to the drinks table.  Donny pours him a nice glassful as Frasier exits._

speaker: Donny
text: Don't worry, Niles.  We'll fix you up with somebody.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thanks Donny, I don't think this is a time for me to be meeting someone new.

speaker: Donny
text: Someone old, then.  You know, an old flame, an ex-girlfriend, someone who got away.  Huh? [_Daphne looks nervous_] Come on Niles, there must be somebody you had your eye on before Mel.

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny, please!  Can't you see you're making him uncomfortable!

speaker: Donny
text: What?  I was just trying to help, honey!  You see, Niles, it's not us, it's the holidays.  It makes women crazy! _Meanwhile, in the hallway, Frasier has his ear to the elevator door. He hears a group arriving and stands back with a gleeful expression to greet them.  The doors open to reveal a packed elevator._

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha, hello everyone!  Come in, come in!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's very nice, ladies first.  Now, no crowding, no pushing. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Where are they going?

speaker: Roz
text: I've got bad news for you.  That feud you were having with the guy upstairs?  It isn't over.  He's having his own party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn him!  He's siphoning off my guests.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you won't believe this.  That dreadful Cam Winston is having a competing party!

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that's what that was.  Some big sign in the lobby, it said "Winston Party 2000."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's his apartment number.  Well, two can play at that game!  Donny!

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives him paper, a pen and some scissors_] Do me a favor, will you?  Make me one of those signs, see what you can fashion out of these crude implements.

speaker: Donny
text: Okay, I'll try.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know whether that's a good idea, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, "Winston Party 2000" sounds like the party of the future. "Crane Party 1901" sounds like... well, this.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't worry about it, Frasier.  You always throw a good party. This place'll be hopping in no time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_into phone_] Hey, Connie, it's a morgue here.  Is the party at the station still happening?  Great, I'll be there as soon as I can.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not going to believe this.  Dr. Crane broke up with Mel.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, I know, I heard.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is there anything you don't know before I do?

speaker: Roz
text: I overheard them at the office Christmas party.

speaker: Daphne
text: Really, what happened?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, okay, don't freak out.  Mel accused Niles of still being in love with someone else.

speaker: Daphne
text: My God, that's me!  I'm someone.

speaker: Roz
text: I said not to freak out.

speaker: Daphne
text: But what if he says something to me?

speaker: Roz
text: Just let him down gently.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it never works out that easily.  You know how it is when you say no to a guy.

speaker: Roz
text: [_uncertain_] Yeah... sure.

speaker: Daphne
text: It just gets messy after that.  You say you'll be friends, but you never are.  It ruins everything.

speaker: Roz
text: He's not going to say anything tonight.  As long as Donny's here you're totally safe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's find a prominent place to put this.  Preferably right on top of Winston's sign! _Donny exits.  Frasier turns back and sees Niles taking a long pull of his glass._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, go easy there, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, haven't you given me enough advice for one day?

speaker: Frasier
text: My canapes! [_goes to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: You know, Niles, you look like you need cheering up. _Martin starts the "Dancing Santa" which knocks over all of the presents, including one with makes a shattering noise._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne's present!

speaker: Martin
text: Did it break?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we won't know until she opens it!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry, but, hey look. [_gives him Mel's present_] You don't need this one for Mel, do you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess not.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, well here. [_swaps gift tags_] Put that in there, and this right in here, problem solved.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now, you two, I don't want everyone congregating in the kitchen.  Now go out and mingle!

speaker: Roz
text: [_acting_] Niles!  Martin!  I didn't see you come in!

speaker: Niles
text: [_echoing_] Roz!  Daphne!  I didn't want to give these out in front of all the guests, but since there aren't any. [_hands over presents_] Roz, this is for you, and Daphne, Merry Christmas.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Merry Christmas, thank you, Dr. Crane. _Niles's mobile rings and takes it into the kitchen.  Meanwhile, the ladies look at their gifts._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_scared_] Oh no, it's jewelry.

speaker: Roz
text: [_bored_] Oh no, it's a book. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment - Later Frasier and Martin are looking up to the next floor.  Frasier is holding a dish with some hors d'oeuvres on it._

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, there must be a hundred people up there!  Well, I'll just show you what you're missing! [_wafts the smell up_] Savory lamb tenders!  Pesto-filled mushroom caps!  Smell �em and weep!

speaker: Martin
text: [_patronizing_] Come on, Frasier.  Maybe we ought to walk you back inside, there you are...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_forlorn_] Oh, Dad...

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Yes, yes darling, that's wonderful.  I'll see you soon. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: That was Mel!

speaker: Frasier
text: And?

speaker: Niles
text: I managed to explain about Yoshi, she's on her way over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank God!

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Another guest! [_off Niles's glare_] Oh, it's also wonderful for you, Niles.  Congratulations.

speaker: Niles
text: There is one minor detail I need to iron out.  I also got a message from Maris saying she wants to see me again. [_gets a bottle of water_] I think she may have mistaken last night's sympathy for affection.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my. Well, Niles, if you want my advice-

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, you know, you really need to stop saying that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You've got to make your feelings clear to her, and the sooner the better.  There's very little point letting it drag on like this.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  I'll speak to her tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: At the moment, I just want to patch things up with Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha.  Well, you know, those antique earrings you bought her should go a long way towards that.

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizing_] Oh... I gave them to Daphne!

speaker: Frasier
text: You did what?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Daphne's gift broke and I didn't think Mel was coming. Dad suggested I switch the gift cards.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake.  Dad and his meddling!  Well, if you want my advice... [_off Niles's glare_] You know where to find me. _Meanwhile, out in room, Roz is getting her coat to leave as Daphne catches her._

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't go.

speaker: Roz
text: Why not?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I'm sorry to interrupt.  I need to speak with you. It's a private matter, would you join me out on the balcony for a moment?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: Whoa!  He's gonna tell you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_imitating her_] Oh no, not tonight, not while Donny's here! [_then_] Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, so I was wrong.  Boy, this is rough.  What are you going to do?

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know.  I guess I won't give him the chance.  I'll speak first, I'll just be direct.  I'll tell him I know how he feels about me, but I don't feel that way about him.  I love Donny, and nothing's going to happen between us.

speaker: Roz
text: Good. [_re-thinks_] Luck!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, er, I wish there were an easier way to say this, I...

speaker: Daphne
text: Wait!  I have something I'd like to say first.  Dr. Crane, I have to tell you that...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Daphne, I am so sorry, what am I thinking?  Here. _Niles, in his usual act of chivalry, takes his coat off and puts it around Daphne._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you.  Anyway, Dr. Crane, I know that... [_once again she can't say it_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, I...

speaker: Niles
text: Why don't I start?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, Dr. Crane...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I really need to say this, I can't wait any longer. Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: This is so difficult for me.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_almost hoping_] Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: I need my Christmas present back.

speaker: Daphne
text: ...You what?! _Meanwhile, in the main room, Frasier, Martin, Donny and Roz are slumped, bored out of their minds._

speaker: Frasier
text: People will go almost anywhere for free food and booze. Am I really so insufferable?

speaker: Roz
text: I could call up the station and see if people want to come over.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh yes, Roz, let's call in the second string guests.  Let's fill my home with a bunch of angry, snubbed co-workers. [_then_] Do you think they'd come?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fashionably late!  Hello, everyone.  Come in, Merry Christmas. Help yourself to the drinks.

speaker: Donny
text: Okay, Marty, how did you get these people down here?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I just called an old buddy in the fire department and told him that that many people in one place had to be a code violation.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that is smart.  But aren't there going to be the same number of people down here?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, everyone, we'll start by singing some carols and then we will choose our teams for "The Minister's Cat."

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Donny_] I don't think that's going to be a problem.

speaker: Niles
text: I feel terrible about this, and of course, I'll replace the gift.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's all right. [_takes coat off_] Well, I won't be needing this anymore. [_hands it back to him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, Daphne, Daphne, you never finished what you were going to say.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, well, it was about the gift.  Well, I could see from the box that you got me jewelry from "Beady & Sons" and I didn't get you anything nearly as grand.  Well, doesn't matter now.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mel.  She's here.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, excuse me. _Niles enters and approaches her as Daphne goes to Roz.  Niles picks up the Christmas present on the way and changes tags._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so glad you came. [_gives her the present_] Merry Christmas.

speaker: Mel
text: Merry Christmas.

speaker: Roz
text: So, how did it go?  Did you tell him?

speaker: Daphne
text: Never got the chance, he went first.  It turned out he'd just given me the wrong gift and wanted it back.

speaker: Roz
text: You're kidding!  You must be so relieved.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say!  I've never been so relieved in my life.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, everyone, we'll start with an easy one.

speaker: Chorus
text: Deck the halls with bows of holly, Fa-la-la-la-la, la-la-la-la, Tis' the season to be jolly, Fa-la-la-la-la, la-la-la-la, Don we now our gay apparel, Fa-la-la-la-la-la, la-la-la. _As they are singing Daphne keeps glancing behind her at Niles and Mel, who are kissing tenderly.  Daphne keeps looking at him with sorrow.  Does she love him?  End of Act Two._
